settingsSchema.title: Datadog RUM Pixel
settingsSchema.description: For more information abour configuring your Datadog RUM Pixel, see https://docs.datadoghq.com/real_user_monitoring/browser/setup/

applicationId.title: Datadog applicationId
applicationId.description: Enter the Application ID from your Datadog RUM Application, the Applicatiion ID should be something like 'b64882ae-821c-4e3a-a6a8-1b438b4af7f3'

clientToken.title: Datadog clientToken
clientToken.description: Enter the Client Token from your Datadog RUM Application, the Client Token should be something like 'pubblictoken'

site.title: Datadog Site
site.description: Enter the Datadog site name, see https://docs.datadoghq.com/getting_started/site/ for more information on how to get yours

service.title: Datadog Service (Application name)
service.description: Enter the Datadog service name, this will be used to identify the application in Datadog RUM. This is commonly the application name that you created in Datadog

version.title: App Version
version.description: Enter a version of you application (store), this will be used to identify the application version in Datadog RUM

sessionSampleRate.title: Session Sample Rate
sessionSampleRate.description: Enter the sample rate for the RUM pixel, this will be used to control the amount of data sent to Datadog RUM

sessionReplaySampleRate.title: Session Replay Sample Rate
sessionReplaySampleRate.description: Enter the sample rate for the RUM pixel for session replays, this will be used to control the amount of data sent to Datadog RUM

trackUserInteractions.title: Track User Interactions
trackUserInteractions.description: Enable or disable tracking of user interactions in the RUM pixel

trackResources.title: Track Resources
trackResources.description: Enable or disable tracking of resources (images, scripts, etc) in the RUM pixel

trackLongTasks.title: Track Long Tasks
trackLongTasks.description: Enable or disable tracking of long tasks in the RUM pixel

defaultPrivacyLevel.title: Default Privacy Level
defaultPrivacyLevel.description: Enter the default privacy level for the RUM pixel, this will be used to control the amount of data sent to Datadog RUM

activateInDev.title: Activate in Dev Mode
activateInDev.description: Enable or disable the RUM pixel in development mode (myvtex)
